summary: Robert W. Genzman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are payroll certifications and reports from 1977 and 1978, indicating that Genzman held a position within the committee during that period. The specific role or responsibilities of Genzman are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll suggests he was involved in the committee's work related to the JFK assassination investigation. The documents provide a timeline of his employment with the HSCA, spanning from at least October 1977 to November 1978. The consistent appearance of his name across multiple payroll documents indicates stable employment within the committee during this period.
significance: Robert W. Genzman's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), which investigated the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in the provided documents, his presence on the committee's payroll indicates his involvement in the investigation process during 1977 and 1978.
